page.title: 02Describing Bookham & Fetcham
page.content: The population of the area has increased dramatically in the last 20 years, but despite that, new residents are aware of a sense of community. There has been much infilling, but the shape of the villages has changed little. The highest point is still the tower of St.Nicolas church and a clearly defined belt of open land surrounds the villages. It is an affluent area with a good age mix. Most families have at least one car and as a result public transport is very poor, both road and rail. Most property is privately owned though there are 3 council estates and several old peoples residences. There are many voluntary clubs, but despite a large population, few are actively engaged in running them. For children there are Scouts, Guides, Boys & Girls Brigades and youth clubs.
